page.title: 01SUMMARY OF BLOCK
page.content: The area covers a rural community in which farming is the dominant form of land use. Two villages are included; Platt's Heath and Harrietsham. In the south-west corner the once extensive woodland of Kingswood has been reduced and new private housing estates built which are the centre of a thriving and prosperous community encompassing a new primary school and village hall. The whole area lays between the chalk North Downs and the Kent Ragstone (Hythe beds) forming the inner scarp face of the north-east edge of the weald. The soil is very fertile and drainage is into the river Len feeding the Medway at Maidstone.
